headline: Black Forest Cake
description: This black forest cake recipe combines soft, moist chocolate sponge cake layers with homemade whipped cream frosting and a sweet sour cherry topping.

video.description: See how to make and decorate a rich chocolate cake.
video.name: Black Forest Cake I

name: Black Forest Cake

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans; line bottoms with parchment paper. Place a medium bowl in the refrigerator to chill.
Whisk flour, sugar, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl. Add eggs, milk, oil, and vanilla; beat until combined. Pour cake batter into the prepared pans.

Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the centers comes out clean, about 35 minutes. Cool layers in pans on wire racks for 10 minutes. Run a paring knife around edges to loosen and invert carefully onto racks to cool completely, 1 to 2 hours.

While cake layers bake, drain cherries for topping, reserving 1/2 cup juice. Combine reserved juice, cherries, sugar, and cornstarch in a 2-quart saucepan. Cook, stirring constantly, over low heat until thickened. Stir in vanilla. Let cool at room temperature for 30 minutes. Transfer to the refrigerator to cool completely before assembling cake.
Combine whipping cream and confectioners' sugar for frosting in the chilled medium bowl. Beat with an electric mixer at high speed until stiff peaks form.

Split each cake layer in half horizontally using a long serrated knife. Tear one layer into crumbs; set aside. Gently brush loose crumbs off top and sides of remaining layers using a pastry brush or your hands. Reserve 1 1/2 cups frosting for piping decorations on cake; set aside.

To assemble, place one cake layer on a cake plate. Spread with 1 cup frosting; top with 3/4 cup cherry topping. Top with second cake layer; repeat layers of frosting and cherry topping. Top with third cake layer and frost sides of cake.

Pat reserved cake crumbs onto sides of cake. Spoon reserved 1 1/2 cups frosting into a pastry bag fitted with a star decorator tip. Pipe around top and bottom edges of cake. Spoon remaining cherry topping on top of cake.
Store covered in the refrigerator until ready to serve.

review.reviewBody: I think this cake has to be the best; I think this should win an Emmy Award.ü•á Seriously.
aaaamazing 10/10 will do again!üòäüíïü§ûüòéüòò

Black Forest has been one of my favourites since I was young. This recipe, the first that came up on my search was far from a real Black Forest cake. Cake was not as fudgey and moist as I would have expected. Sour cherries are just not available in Canada and since one is essentially making pie filling anyway and the canned version is already tart it works perfectly add a touch of lemon juice and vanilla to get the tin flavour out. I have never in my life seen or heard of using the crumbs to coat the sides of the cake but I guess is a chinsy version of using grated chocolate‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.I will stick with grated chocolate myself. Overall a good basic recipe for a beginner baker or for the kid bakers or at the very least a basic how too. Make your own deep chocolate cake for the base cake. Secondly the whipped cream recipe used here will likely fall within a day without some sort of stabilizer like skim milk powder or cream of tarter to allow it to hold for a couple days. In the end maybe just use an entirely different recipe or make your own adjustments as most here seem to be doing.

I‚Äôve never had a black forest cake so i‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs authentic tasting but i made it for my moms birthday and she was very happyüòå. Instead of crumbling a whole layer of cake for the outside, i just shaved off the sides so it could still be four layers. also, for the whipped icing i recommend adding merengue powder so the icing can stiffen and not become liquid overnight and to avoid the cake collapsing. I put about 3 teaspoons and it worked like a charmüëç

What idiocy. The bake time is way too long, even allowing for differences in operation temperatures. The assembly is disgusting. Crumbling one layer and sticking it to the sides of the others?!?! Please, don't bother.
I loved making this cake! Beautiful and delicious!‚ù§Ô∏è- Cindy R. in Matthews, NC
It was very easy to follow the video and bake the cake. The cake came out really good. It was moist and delicious.
Didn‚Äôt pipe but followed all the other steps.

This is my third time ever making a cake from scratch and my family LOVED IT!üôåüèº Even though it is not mentioned in the recipe , many people commented about making the cherry filling first! Definitely do it, so it has more time to cool down! Also save some of the drained cherry juice so you can brush some on your layers before you begin to assemble your cake. My cherries seemed alittle banged up from the can, I don‚Äôt know why ü§∑üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è But it didn‚Äôt affect the taste.I definitely will be making this recipe again ‚ò∫Ô∏è
I Love Cake And I Love This Recipe .

I highly recommend following the advice of other reviewers and myself when I say: 1) cooking the cherry filling (and the cakes for that matter) at least a day beforehand to cool 2) using gelatin to stabilize the whipping cream 3) using the additional cake layer instead of crumbling it because it looks prettier 4) maybe even sprinkling shredded chocolate flakes on top like I did? 5) putting a cherry syrup in the cake, as it would have been VERY dry without it.

I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve ever had a Black Forest cake before so I can compare with others. But it was requested and I found this recipe. I must say, we all enjoyed eating it! And it is very impressive to make/look at. Crazy - I forgot the vanilla in the cake portion, but it still turned out fine. I‚Äôm sure it would‚Äôve been better tho! I took 1 star off just because for my taste, I think I would‚Äôve liked it to be a tad sweeter. (I don‚Äôt think the vanilla would‚Äôve affected that.) Or maybe it would‚Äôve, in which case I‚Äôd give it 5 stars. But other people liked it bc it wasn‚Äôt too sweet. It was relatively easy to make, impressive, and quite delicious.

I made this cake & was disappointing. The cake was dry. I have a much better recipe for a chocolate cake. Also couldn‚Äôt find sour cherries so I had to substitute canned cherry pie filling. For all the work & expense & time if I make again I‚Äôll be using my own chocolate cake recipe,

Did 4 layers instead, chopped up semi sweet chips in food processor froze then did sides. Also used 2 cans cherry pie filling , so can skip a step! Brushed layers with substitute of vanilla vodka and used leftover cherry goop from filling as no Kirsch available. Chilled in between whipped cream and chocolate application. Came out great!! Will decorate with cherries on top of piped whipped cream on top but cake top wouldn‚Äôt fit so left until presentation. It‚Äôs my 64th birthday cake reminiscent of my time in Bavaria in USAF , used my birthday present, a stand mixer, not too sweet very moist!
Came out so good. Thanks a ton.

i totally love this recipe, this cake has been on my bucket list to make for a very long time . i choose this recipe and it turned out amazing. my picture will not load but it tastes amazing and a picture would not do it justice anyway hehe, i'm gonna make it again very soon.

Great recipe! The sweet and chocolatey cake combined with the slightly sweet whipped cream and cherries makes for the perfect combination. The heavy and light textures make for a great combination also.
Turned out great. Love that the icing is so easy to make.
Very good and easy to make, I replaced the cherries with just cherry pie fill as I could not find pitted cherries.
Heaven on Earth!
I only used 2 layers, did not use crumbled cake on sides and did not used pastry bag to decorate.

great recipe, first time ever making a black forest cake and it turned out lovely! my husband loves chocolate cake and he was obsessed, as was my 3 year old! Someone had said this was an expensive cake to make and i don‚Äôt see how that was possible, aside from sour cherries which are not overly pricey the ingredients were all basic ingredients! Make sure you really mix the batter and scrap the bottom of the bowl to ensure an even bake! happy baking y‚Äôall!
Came out pretty good.
I added some chocolate powder to the frosting and made two big layers and it came out great! I would rate it 10 stars if I could!
Turned out great but I wanted it to look a little more put together so used maraschino cherries on top and none of the cherry mix from the layers.
I love the cherry filling in this recipe and the chocolate cake. Sometimes I modify the frosting with my own recipe but the base of this recipe I use over and over again.?
Turned out Amazing. Perfection
Followed the recipe as mentioned, extremely bland and dry base cake, with a lot of cream and cherries wasted, even though taken in the quantity mentioned. Average recipe.

This is the best cake I have ever made. It is so moist and flavorful. I had to substitute can cherry pie filling for the bitter cherries the recipe called for. I couldn‚Äôt find them. I don‚Äôt think it changed the taste because everyone raved over it. There was not a piece left to be had. Will definitely be making this many many more times!
Great. My first time making this recipe. Will make again.

Followed the directions exactly and it turned out perfect. Only change I made was using a stabilized whipped cream (added a little gelatin) so the cream would hold its shape for a couple days. Delicious.

I‚Äôm a spaz with the pastry bag so it looks a little messy but it tasted amazing! I used frozen sour cherries from a local farm and added a bit of gelatin to the whipped cream since it was for an outdoor (socially distanced) gathering.
Great recipe! Although I changed it a bit by adding 2 tablespoons of Dark Rum in the Cherry filling while it was boiling!
Great recipe my family and cousins loved this cake ..... And I started a home bakery with this recipe

Very good! The frosting is perfect, but my cherry mixture slid off of the cake so that layer wasn‚Äôt very pronounced. I also used 1 1/2 cups of sugar instead of 2 for the cake; 3/4 cup of sugar for the cherry mixture. Both reductions were good.

Cake was absolutely yummy, |I did make some changes.. I used 4 cups of cream and added a little extra icing sugar for it. I used frozen sour cherries from Poland.
I used all 4 layers in the cake and used grated 85 percent dark chocolate for the outside .
yessss

Everyone loved this cake. The only thing I would change is with the cherry filling recipe. Make the sauce without putting the cherries in the pan until it has thickened. My cherries were too mushy. But it was so delicious‚Äô

Great recipe! This is the best black forest cake I have ever made. I made a few modifications:
Blended in egg yolks, beat egg whites and folded in.
Used bada cherries cut in half, drained the juice and used amount in the recipe but did not add sugar. Thickened juice with cornstarch and spread on each layer, added cherries to whipped cream and spread between layers.
Reduced confectioners sugar by half
I did not cut the layers in half as the layers were not high enough; I made a third layer for a higher cake. Did not mash cake for the sides, instead frosted and put chocolate shavings all around. 
Decorated with maraschino cherries, well drained.
I think I overmixed the batter.
This recipe is super easy to whip up and makes an impressive cake. I purchased cherry filling to cut the preparation time.

I made it for Thanksgiving with my grandaughter this afternoon and made wonderful memories with her. My granddaughter wanted a chocolate cake and decided to challenge ourselves in baking this beautiful cake. It was really a joint effort and had so much fun in making come together. 

The only change we made was the two cans of tart cherries it called for; we added one can tart and the other sweet making them two different shades of red and two different sizes of cherries. You can see the two colors together made a great combination on top.

Tip, before adding the cherry filling between the layers or on top, make sure it has been cooled off enough or they will be runny. I placed the cherry filling in freezer as I placed the icing on the cake. Gave them more consistency.

I have been making this cake for well over 10 years.
Came back again today to get the recipe and figured it was about time I gave it a review.

Everyone loves this cake and nobody ever believes I made it.
What like a mechanic/Cattle Rancher can't follow instructions?

I don't really change much when I make it except for the cherries.
We can our own cherries so I use a couple of quarts of them when I make this cake.
Be patient, when the recipe says stir constantly over low heat until thickened they mean it, plan on being at the stove for 20 minutes and you will end up with a filling people will rave about.
I cut the dome off each cake before cutting in half and make a 4 layer version using the dome pieces to break up into crumbs to coat the whip cream on the sides.
Along with the cake crumbs on the sides I grate bakers chocolate and use it as well.
Take your time, follow instructions, make the cherry filling one day, make the cake the next then make the cream and assemble the following day.
Cake is best after it has chilled in fridge overnight.
Yes It takes 4 days before you can eat my cake but nobody has ever complained yet and leftovers never exist.
This cake tastes sooo good!! It turned out perfectly!

Great recipe. I agree with others that I found it difficult to find the canned cherries so I just used cherry pie filling. 

 I also made mine 4 layers instead of 3 but I crumbled the cut off from when I levelled the cakes and added that to the bottom of the cake. I then also made a chocolate ganache and made it a drip cake.
I made this cake for my husband's 39th birthday on Wednesday. It turned out really well. My 5 year old daughter had fun putting on the cherries.

It was Okay, not fantastic. I didn't follow the recipe to the exact as I'm cheap; bought cherry pie filling, So can't comment on the cherries. But for the cake recipe the ratio of wet to dry seemed off and it was so I added a cup more of milk. That worked, otherwise the cake was average not the best but not the worst either. I was also surprised to see no Kirsch, weird for a Black forest cake to not have (but again I'm cheap so meh). If you're going to make this cake be prepared to make alterations.

I just made this cake and it is absolutely delicious! The chocolate cake has a nice vanilla taste to it which goes perfectly with the whipped cream and cherry topping. I used maraschino cherries instead of sour and I was a little worried they would be too sweet but it turned out excellent!

My family loved it even if it looked like a Pinterest fail. I used cherry pie filling plus a jar of sour cherries. Spiked the filling with a little cherry brandy. Made four layers, it looked bad but tasted good. I didn‚Äôt have an icing bag to pipe the whipped cream so...
It was amazing. The best cake I have made to date

This was my first time ever making a Black Forest Cake, and it was great! I added more cocoa powder, less sugar (and half brown/half white at that), butter instead of oil, and buttermilk in place of regular milk in the cake!.Turned out nice and dark chocolatey! Yum! And for the cherries, I simply used some of my frozen tart cherries, put them in a pot to heat up, and followed along with the recipe for adding corn starch and sugar to them from there. Those worked great too! This is a great recipe, thanks for sharing!

I was looking for a cake like my oma used to make, and with this I found it. I made it for my mother and she was over the moon at how similar this was. It's been a long time since I made/decorated any cake so it could look better-and it was difficult to pat chocolate on the sides (I used shaved semi-sweet bakers chocolate), but the taste was right on. It even travelled across town well.
Not too complicated to make because it's made with love. Looks delicious.
Delicious and easy to make! Perfect birthday cake.
Good
It was good but a little dry.
Black Forest Cake came out really well ...
I made this for my sons‚Äô 40th Birthday It was a great success.

This cake turned out great. I gave the recipe five because I liked the cake itself very much. I made a few alterations like using cherry pie filling for between the layers and didn‚Äôt grumble on of the cake layers instead had four layers. The end result was an easy cake that looked great (used shaved chocolate for a dusting over the whipped cream). It also stored well covered in the fridge for leftovers.

This was a great cake. I liked that it did not include alcohol; I don't care for Kirschwasser. The chocolate cake is a great stand alone recipe. It was easy - love a good one bowl cake. The crumb was tender, cake moist without falling apart, and the flavor was sublime. The cherry filling was so easy and not a cloying sweet like canned pie filling. I did reduce the amount of sugar by 1/4 - 1/3 cup to keep some of the tart of the cherries. That tart really did provide some balance to this cake. The quantity of heavy whipping cream called for was way too much. I think 2 cups, prior to whipping, would have been ample. Otherwise, the powder sugar was a great addition. It was not too sweet and was the crowning touch to this cake. It was truly a great cake - the ladies I shared it with were full of compliments - appearance, taste, texture! I will definitely be making this again. Thank you Linda Greer for this tasty contribution!
amazing!

This cake turned out wonderfully!! Perfect recipe!! I made it exactly as-is, except I used two cans of cherry pie filling, instead of making my own filling because I couldn‚Äôt find the pitted cherries - and it was still great. Much easier than it LOOKS - and is a great presentation!
I added Ciroc Black Raspberry vodka to the cherries and espresso to the cake mix and it came out fine considering it was my first cake!
I make this several times a year for my husband. It's one of his favorite cakes.
It was really good, everyone loved it but I put the toppings on when the cake was still a little warm so it melted.
It was really good, everyone loved it but I put the toppings on when the cake was still a little warm so it melted.
Was my first time making black forest cake and it was successful. This recipe was very easy to follow and it tasted delicious!
I would make double of the icing recipe part we didnt have enough when we made the icing and we would also put less cherries in the cake.
Almost fell over, but it was delicious
I would cut the amount of cherries in half and double the whipped cream. The cake tastes delicious has a lot of flavour.
Delicious cake that was easy to put together. I used canned cherry pie filling to expedite the process. Everybody loved it. Super moist!

My family absolutely loved it! Sweet, but not too sweet. I was hesitant to use that much sugar first, but decided to follow the recipe and it was a good decision since the sourness of cherries balanced the sweetness perfectly. Very moist cake. I am sure it will become our new favourite cake. Thank you for the recipe!

I made this for Fathers Day & like so many things about this cake & will try to make again but unfortunately it turned out dry after 25 minutes in the oven. The flavour & presentation was beautiful, maybe it will be better tomorrow ??
The recipe should include cherry brandy. This is actually illegal to be called Schwarzwald cake in Germany.

I will definitely make it again. In fact, this was my second time using this recipe. The first time I followed the recipe exactly. This time I needed to save time, so I substituted Duncan Hines Comstock brand cherry pie filling and it was every bit as good. I used the pie filling they say has 20 % more cherries and there were really lots of cherries in it.
I've made this cake a number of times and it is quick, easy and delicious . I do make a couple substitutes by using pie filling and a tub of cool whip.
This cake is phenomenal!!!

I made no changes to this recipe.
This cake was a huge hit.
I will definitely use this recipe again
This was a hit! Our friends were having a German dinner night so I made the Black Forest cake and it was amazing! Definitely a keeper.

Very good cake, but I was glad I checked it early...I didn't need to bake 35 minutes. After reading comments, I substituted the vanilla with 1/4 cup Kirsch and cut the sugar in half for the sour cherries in a jar. Also, from comments, kept all 4 layers and brushed each with Kirsch and used shaved chocolate on the outside. Excellent and will make it again! And....did make it a day ahead, except for final layer of whipping cream and top cherries.

Overall a great cake with excellent flavours however the whipped cream frosting broke down very quickly which made this cake hard to cut and not so pretty to serve to my guests. They all loved the flavours, i was the one disappointed with the presentation

I‚Äôm giving this one four stars, it was good, but not fantastic. The sour cherries have a bland color and I need to add red food coloring to the cherries to make them a pretty color. I thought the cake was a bit dry and could have used a brush with a chocolate syrup or cherry brandy. I also filled another reviewers tip to stabilize the whipped cream with gelatin to make the whipped cream hold up. I choose to use all four layers in the cake and used grated chocolate on the sides of the cake, instead of crumbled cake. Also, it serves more than 12, I could have easily served ;16, as it‚Äôs very rich

Easy, delicious and a show stopper! Very elegant for celebrations, or if you just love a delicious chocolaty cake with cherries and whipped cream. I only added Belgium grated chocolate flakes on top. I baked the cake one day before and made my cherry sauce. The next day I only had to whip the cream and assemble the cake. It was great to make my cake from scratch too. Cooking my own cherry sauce enabled me to add more cherries to the sauce than what you get in a can of pie cherry sauce.
Delicious chocolate cake recipe! Will be my go to for cakes!

All I did was add 2 teaspoons almond extract to the cake batter and 1 teaspoon to the cherry sauce... I'm German and it's gotta taste like cherry through and through! Your directions were awesome! Tasted just like Oma's!
A little less sugar in the whipped cream. Yes make it a lot.

I used real cherries since they were in season. It was more work but it was worth it. I boiled them for 20-25 minutes until they were cooked and then pitted them. They were much easier to pit once they were cooked. Then I added the cornstarch and sugar. I put much less sugar than was called for in all of the recipe since I don't like it too sweet. I found the batter was not enough to put into 2 pans. The batter was very good tasting and had the right amount of chocolate. I would make it again. If you want a very high cake, you may want to double the batter. I would make it again. It was delicious!

This was a great recipe! Everyone loved it. I made it for Mother's Day. My mom's favorite cake is Black Forest, and because we have children we couldn't use alcohol. So this was a great recipe for a kid-friendly cake. I made the cherry mixture and cake the day before and assembled it the day-of. I was worried it would be too wet if I did it the day before. Turns out, it might have been better to make it the day before to incorporate the moisture from the cherries into the cake. The cake recipe was wonderful - it had a fudge consistency. I also used shaved chocolate instead of the crumbled cake. It added texture. It was a big hit! I'll be using this recipe again!
This is a great recipe! Time consuming but it's worth it. Thanks for sharing the recipe.
Easy to make! A great tasting cake. I think it's worth the effort to find the cherries rather than going for pie filling. Will make again.

Thanks for shairing this sooo wonderful article. Everyone can learn by this article. Again Thankyou sooo much!!!!	

http://www.cakengifts.in/cake-delivery-in-delhi
Delicious and perfect :)

Awesome! A little labor intensive , but overall not too bad. I made the cakes and froze them a few days ahead of time which was hugely helpful. On the day that I assembled the cake, I make the cherry filling early in the day so it had plenty of time to cool before I actually needed it. Although I was a little worried about how easily the whipped cream would pipe, it held up great. I made it for a birthday party and I will definitely make it again!
This cake came out fantastic!! So delicious and not at all super sweet. The only modification I made was where it called for espresso, I replaced it with kirsch. Would definitely make this again!
It was an awesome cake! Didn't sog too with the cherry syrup..
reason for 3 stars was, to me the cake was on the dry side. The changes I made, I used maraschino cherry buttercream frosting, and cherry pie filling.

Excellent dense cake!! 2 tips...Be sure to add a couple of tablespoons of sour cream to ensure moistness and heat the cherries at a HIGH heat, stirring constantly, otherwise cherries will break apart. Also, If you don't like the whipped cream icing you could use a cream cheese icing. Family loved it!!!

This is the best chocolate cake recipe I've ever tasted. It was moist and people raved about it. Anybody that said the cake did not come out right or was not moist obviously didn't cook it correctly. I couldn't find sour cherries so I used sweet cherries in a can. They were wonderful. To add more depth to the cake I made a Kahl√∫a glaze and brushed each layer with it. Everyone that had a piece was in total chocolate heaven. It was the highlight of my Christmas dinner.

I followed this recipe to the exactly. It turned out great! My wife loved this cake for her birthday. It was even better after it sat in the refrigerator overnight. I recommend making this the day before the occasion you're going to use it for . It looked exactly the way it is in the picture.
